headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; LATE AND INTERESTING FROM CHINA. POPULAR EMEUTE IN. BRUSSELS Cotton Firm--Breadstuffs Dull--Consols 94 The steamship Vande bit. D. L. ?? THE SLAVE-TRADE AND GEN. CONCHA. Expectations of a War Between Spain and Mexico Revived. Arrival of the Vanderbilt and North American Progress of the Atlantic Telegraph En terprise.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Vande bit, D.L. WILOOX, Esq., commanding, from Havre on the 2d, and Southampton on the evening of the 3d, with 101 passengers, $58,000 in specie, and 500 tons merchandise, arrived at her dock early yesterday morning. On the 9th and 10th ult. encountered strong westerly gales, and throughout the entire passage head winds and rough sea.

headline.main: Gen. Scott not to be at Bunker Hill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. SCOTT writes the following letter to Boston, in explanation of his failure to be present this week at the Bunker Hill celebration: NEW-YORK, Thursday, June 11, 1857. GENTLEMEN: I had the honor to receive, in due time, your note informing me that you were a
docs.abstract: Could not attend Bunker hill celebration

docs.lead_paragraph: BOGUS ALARM ABOUT THE YELLOW FEVER.-- Some of our cotemporaries are pursuing a very dangerous policy in respect to the sanitary con dition of the City, and are doing all they can to spread the belief among our distant and rural neighbors, that New-York is already filled with yellow fever, cholera, and every imaginablepestilence;

headline.main: THE PUBLIC HEALTH.; The Shipping Interest Plotting a Dodge, Interesting to Staten Island Tax-Payers. THE LATEST FROM' SEGUINE'S POINT. Threats to Burn Old Quarantine,--Dominick Ragans, Ray Tompkins, Bsq., & c. THE CITY NEVER IN BETTER SPIRITS The False Report of the Yellow Fever in Town. THE TRUE STATE OF THE CASE AND WHERE THE YELLOW FEVER REALLY IS. Why the Bark Mary is Quarantined and why the Lucy Heywood is sent to the Infected Anchorage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The City health remains unusually good; the deaths laet week were only 393, 19 lees thn the pre feeding week, which was a great improvement upon the week still previous. The deaths from smallpox which were 14 for the week ending June 9, were only ? The reduction in scarlet fever is almost equally agreeable: this week the deaths were but 16, whilethe week before they were 30.
